description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2nqra","text":"This step-by-step protocol describes the cDNA synthesis, primer pools preparation and multiplex PCR conditions with the main goal to sequence the complete genome of DENV1 serotype strains.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6q2ge","text":"Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"711d5","text":"
Reverse transcription: SuperScript™ IV First-Strand Synthesis System. (200 reactions) Cat:
18091200 Invitrogen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2hcq","text":"
Multiplex PCR: Q5® High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix. Cat: M0492L NEB, H20 Ultre Pure,
primers described in table 1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5dh29","text":" Using a 2mL tube prepare the Mix 1 described below for 96 samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3runt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnqnd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"beff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4e0d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d14db","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eakpa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qfbk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",null],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Mix 1\nReverse transcription","Vol. (1x) ","96 samples (+2 = 98 to keep some extra due to pipetting issues)"],["Random Hexamers (50µM) ","1µL ","98µL"],["dNTPs mix (10mM each) ","1µL ","98µL"],["Total","2µL","194µL"]],"guid":"C16715B0379411EE82FC210F39AA6C0E","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Mix 1\nReverse transcription","Vol. (1x) ","96 samples (+2 = 98 to keep some extra due to pipetting issues)"],["Random Hexamers (50µM) ","1µL ","98µL"],["dNTPs mix (10mM each) ","1µL ","98µL"],["Total","2µL","194µL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nelo","text":"Using 0,2mL PCR tubes or 96 wells plates add 11-16µL of extracted RNA from\nRT-PCR positive samples. Add 2µL of Mix 1 to the tube/well and take it to the\nthermocycler with the following set up","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":104,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fj9r6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9006r","text":"65ºC ---- 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd1ti","text":"Take the tubes/wells to ice for 1 minute (you can prepare a water bath with ice cubes to have a uniform temperature distribution).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"816jq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"rjtc","text":"Using a 2mL tube prepare Mix 2:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4pgr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mkgq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7hi8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"34ei8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_6":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":" "}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Mix 2

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kjrc","text":"Add 7µL of Mix 2 to the tubes containing the Mix 1 plus RNA and take it to the thermocycler following the set up below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11qnv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mign","text":"Step1:
42ºC ---- 50 minutes
70ºC ---- 10 minutes
4ºC ---- Hold","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3b3o4","text":"Store the cDNA at -20ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63c1v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ln5c","text":"Observation:. As a suggestion, to improve the final results only samples RT-PCR positive showing a Ct value of \u003c 30 should be used for cDNA conversion and genomic amplification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ri8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5cfp","text":"Prepare the Mix 1 for a Multiplex PCR for each Pool 1 and Pool 2 using a Falcon tube

{"blocks":[{"key":"btoto","text":"Using the original 100uM primer solution eluted individually, put them together following the table below containing each primer volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aobph","text":"Pool 1 will have a final volume of 130µl and pool 2 of 170µl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cea53","text":"In order to prepare the solution to use in the Multiplex PCR, dilute each pool 1:10.
